chapter.title: DataSource
chapter.para: Refers to a service creating Connection(javax.sql.Connection) object to connect to given Database. Anyframe is using the following DataSource implementations as they are which implement a logic to get Connection object by Connection Provider.

section.title: JDBCDataSource Configuration
section.para: Creates Database Connection by using JDBC driver. Returns new connection to all getConnection() call. In actual operation setting, the usage of JDBCDataSource is not recommended, and DBCPDataSource or C3P0DataSource are used instead.

section.title: Samples
section.para: The following is an example of JDBCDataSource configuration.

listitem.para: The following is a part of context-datasource.xml, configuration file of DBCDataSource. In the configuration file below, JDBCDataSource Bean is defined based on HSQL DB.
listitem.programlisting: <bean id="dataSource" class="org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DriverManagerDataSource"> <property name="driverClassName" value="org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver" /> <property name="url" value="jdbc:hsqldb:file:/./db/sampledb" /> <property name="username" value="sa" /> </bean>

section.title: DBCPDataSource Configuration
section.para: Another implementation which creates Database Connection by using JDBC driver. Database Connection Pool of Jakarta named Commons DBCP. This can be checked through all configuration parameter through DBCP documentation.

row.entry: Sets class name of jdbc driver.
Sets username to use when accessing DataBase.
Sets password to use when accessing DataBase.
Sets the maximum number of active connection that can be assigned simultaneously.
Sets the maximum number of idle connection to leave in pool.
Sets the maximum waiting time when all connections are in use.
Sets whether or not to set auto-commit for connection returned from this datasource.
Assigns read-only property to connection created by Connection Pool.
Assigns transaction isolation property to returned connection.
Sets the minimum number of idle connection of Connection pool.
Sets the initial connection size to be created at Connection pool.

Decides whether or not to check the validation of the object before getting it from Connection pool. 'true' value causes no problems, but validationQuery property must be defined as 'non-null string'.
Decides whether or not to check the validation of the object before returning the object. 'true' value has no impact, but validationQuery property must be defined as 'non-null string'.
Sets whether or not idle object evictor will check the validation of connection. 'true' value has no impact, but validationQuery property must be defined as 'non-null string'.
Sets login timeout(in seconds) for connecting to Database. Initializes connection pool by calling createDataSource().

section.title: Samples
section.para: The following is an example of configuration of DBCPDataSource.

listitem.para:
The following is a part of context-datasource.xml , configuration file of DBCPDataSource. The following configuration file defines DBCPDataSource Bean based on HSQL DB.
<bean id="dataSource" class="org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource" destroy-method="close"> <property name="driverClassName" value="org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver"/> <property name="url" value="jdbc:hsqldb:file:/./db/sampledb"/> <property name="username" value="sa"/> <property name="maxActive" value="100"/> <property name="maxIdle" value="30"/> <property name="maxWait" value="1000"/> <property name="defaultAutoCommit" value="true"/> <property name="removeAbandoned" value="true"/> <property name="removeAbandonedTimeout" value="60"/> <property name="logAbandoned" value="true"/> </bean>
Example code is included in Test Case.

section.title: C3P0DataSource Configuration
section.para: Another implementation which creates Database Connection by using JDBC driver. For details on C3P0 Library, refer to C3P0 Configuration.

section.title: Samples
section.para: The following is an example of configuration of C3P0DataSource.

listitem.para:
The following is a part of context-datasource.xml, configuration file of C3P0DataSource. The following configuration file defines C3P0DataSource Bean based on HSQL DB.
<bean id="dataSource" class="com.mchange.v2.c3p0.ComboPooledDataSource" destroy-method="close"> <property name="driverClass" value="org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver"/> <property name="jdbcUrl" value="jdbc:hsqldb:file:/./db/sampledb"/> <property name="user" value="sa"/> <property name="minPoolSize" value="5"/> <property name="acquireIncrement" value="5"/> <property name="maxPoolSize" value="15"/> </bean>

section.title: JNDIDataSource Configuration
section.para: JNDIDataSource creates Database Connection by using JNDI Lookup. JNDIDataSource gets ataSource mostly from JNDI tree provided in Enterprise application server.
JNDIDataSource can generally register and use singleton factory(e.g.JNDI-bound DataSource) of application context, and can refer to necessary application service as a bean.

Basically searches JNDI cached at startup. This can be customized through "lookupOnStartup" and "cache" property and can use JndiObjectTargetSource. If actual JNDI object type is not defined in advance, definition of proxyInterface is needed.

row.entry: Sets JNDI template for JNDI search. Can set JNDI environment as "jndiEnvironment".
Sets JNDI environment for JNDI search. Creates JndiTemplate provided in configuration.

Sets whether it is possible to search at J2EE container. If prefix is "java:comp/env/", addition is needed as JNDI name is not included. Default value is "false". Note. Cannot be applied if scheme is not given with "java:",etc.
Assign the type of JNDI object.
Sets JNDI name for search. If resourceRef is set as 'true' and does not start with "java:comp/env/", this prefix must be added.
Sets JNDI name for search. If resourceRef is set as 'true' and does not start with "java:comp/env/", this prefix must be added.
Sets whether to search JNDI object at startup. In lazy lookup, definition of proxy interface is needed.
Sets whether to cache JNDI object.
Sets default object in the case of failure of JNDI lookup. This can be arbitrary bean reference or literal value. Note. Can be supported only at lookup at startup.

section.title: Samples
section.para: The following is an example of configuration of JNDIDataSource. This defines the property of JNDI Server to "jnditemplate" Bean and refers to "jnditemplate" Bean at "dataSource" Bean and get Connection object.

listitem.programlisting:
<bean id="dataSource" class="org.springframework.jndi.JndiObjectFactoryBean"> <property name="jndiName" value="AnyframeDS"/> <property name="jndiTemplate" ref="jnditemplate"/> </bean>
<bean id="jnditemplate" class="org.springframework.jndi.JndiTemplate"> <property name="environment"> <props> <prop key="java.naming.factory.initial"> weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory </prop> <prop key="java.naming.provider.url"> t3://server.ip:7001 </prop> </props> </property> </bean>

section.title: Using JNDIDataSource through jee schema
section.para: From Spring 2.0, simple definition is supported for JNDI object lookup through jee Namespace tag. The following is JNDIDataSource setting using jee:jndi-lookup.

listitem.programlisting:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:jee="http://www.springframework.org/schema/jee" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-2.5.xsd http://www.springframework.org/schema/jee http://www.springframework.org/schema/jee/spring-jee-2.5.xsd">
<jee:jndi-lookup id="dataSource" jndi-name="AnyframeDS" resource-ref="true"> <jee:environment> java.naming.factory.initial=weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory java.naming.provider.url=t3://server.ip:7001 </jee:environment> </jee:jndi-lookup> </beans>

section.para: Compared with definition by using JndiObjectFactoryBean and JndiTemplate, using jee tag significantly simplifies definition, hence recommended. For details on jee schema, refer to here.

section.title: Test Case

listitem.para:
Download hsqldb.zip file which contains test DB and anyframe.sample.datasource.zip file which contains sample code and then extract them in the following. Then, execute start.cmd (or start.sh) file in hsqldb folder and start test DB.
Maven-based execution
After moving to extracted directory in the command window, execute 'mvn compile exec:java -Dexec.mainClass=...' command and check the result. Refer to JavaDoc of Main class in each Eclipse project.
Eclipse-based execution
After importing extracted directory at Eclipse, select Main.Java under anyframe/sample/datasource of src/main/java and click mouth right button, and then click Run As > Java Application on context menu. Then, check the execution result.
